task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 149°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the main building including roofline, so I'll tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The heading is now incorrect (0°N) for the target building at ~149°SE, so I should rotate right to re-acquire the building while keeping the upward pitch.
To estimate height accurately I need to see the roofline against the sky, so I should tilt up while staying on the building.
The view reset to 0°N again, so I must rotate to ~149°SE to keep the target building in frame for height estimation.
I need a clearer sense of scale from closer range, so moving toward the building will help judge floors and overall height.
I’m now facing away from the target direction (~149°SE), so I should rotate left to bring the main building back into view.
To face the target building at ~149°SE from 283°W, I should rotate left (counterclockwise) to approximately 149°.
I should directly rotate to the target bearing (~149°SE) to get the building centered for height estimation.
Instead of incremental left/right which seems to oscillate, I will set an absolute rotation to face 149°SE directly.
I need to face 149°SE, so I will rotate left by 77° from 226° to align with the target building direction.
Rotations are toggling between two headings, so I'll use a move to change viewpoint and then re-acquire the building direction afterward.
To align with the target at ~149°SE from 226°SW, I should rotate left by about 77° to center the building.
The view keeps snapping back to 283° after rotations, so I will rotate to the left preset (to 193°) which is closer to 149° and then fine-tune.
From 270°W I need to reach ~149°SE, so rotating left to 180° (south) is the fastest preset toward the target.
The rotation didn’t change the heading last time, so I will use an absolute rotation command to set the view to 149°SE directly.
There is a direct preset to the desired 149°SE (look left), so I should rotate there to view the target building.
Since rotations are unreliable, I'll move to a new node that may give a clearer stable view of the building direction.
From 226°SW, turning left toward 136° puts me close to the target 149° and should bring the building into view.
I should stop trying to rotate in 90° steps and instead set a custom yaw to face 149°SE from 270°W by rotating left 121°.
There is an explicit option to look left to heading 149°, which directly satisfies the required facing direction for the building.
Given heading instability, I will move to the front-left node to change position and potentially lock onto the target building more reliably.
Looking left to ~137° will place me near the target 149° and should bring the main building into view for estimating its height.
I can't reliably rotate to 149° and I'm near the step limit, so I will provide a reasonable height estimate based on a typical 3–4 story campus/office block (~3.5 m per floor).
